His four solo albums have been certified at least [[Music recording sales certification|multi-platinum]], and in 2007, he was charted as the number-one best selling artist in the United States with over 21 million records in that country.{{cite web|url=http://www.thatjoshgrobanguy.com/ |title=That Josh Groban Guy |publisher=That Josh Groban Guy |date= |accessdate=2011-03-12}}{{cite web|url=http://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?resultpage=1&table=SEARCH_RESULTS&action=&title=&artist=JOSH%20GROBAN&format=&debutLP=&category=&sex=&releaseDate=&requestNo=&type=&level=&label=&company=&certificationDate=&awardDescription=&catalogNo=&aSex=&rec_id=&charField=&gold=&platinum=&multiPlat=&level2=&certDate=&album=&id=&after=&before=&startMonth=1&endMonth=1&startYear=1958&endYear=2011&sort=Artist&perPage=25 |title=Gold & Platinum - March 12, 2011 |publisher=RIAA |date= |accessdate=2011-03-12}} To date, he has sold over 24 million albums worldwide.{{cite web|url=http://www.classical-crossover.co.uk/artprofiles/124-josh-groban.html/ |title=Josh Groban |publisher=Classical-crossover.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-03-12}} Groban originally studied acting, but as his voice changed, it developed into a "significant instrument". Groban attended the [[Los Angeles County High School for the Arts|Los Angeles High School for the Arts]], a free public school where students received a conservatory-style education. His life changed when his vocal coach, Seth Riggs, submitted a tape of Josh singing "All I Ask of You", from ''[[The Phantom of the Opera (1986 musical)|The Phantom of the Opera]]'', to Riggs' friend, producer, composer and arranger [[David Foster]].{{cite news| url=http://www.nytimes.com/2002/07/28/arts/music-the-new-boy-wonder-of-the-voice.html?sec=&spon=&pagewanted=al | work=The New York Times | title=MUSIC; The New Boy Wonder of the Voice | first=Matthew | last=Gurewitsch | date=July 28, 2002}}Ruhlmann, William [{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p512890/biography|pure_url=yes}} "Josh Groban > Biography"]. allmusic. Rovi Corporation. Foster called him to stand in for an ailing [[Andrea Bocelli]] to rehearse a duet, "[[The Prayer (Celine Dion and Andrea Bocelli song)|The Prayer]]," with [[Celine Dion]] at the rehearsal for the [[Grammy Award]]s in 1998.[http://www.answers.com/topic/josh-groban "Josh Groban: Biography from Answers.com"]. answers.com. Kelley, performing "You're Still You" for the 2001 season finale. ==Early life and education== Groban was born in [[Los Angeles]], to Lindy (nÃ©e Johnston), a school teacher and full time mother, and Jack Groban, a businessman.{{cite web|url=http://www.thatjoshgrobanguy.com/bio.php |title=That Josh Groban Guy |publisher=That Josh Groban Guy |date= |accessdate=2011-03-12}}{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/reviews/article-426651/The-popera-boy-struts-stuff.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title=The popera boy struts his stuff | first=Adrian | last=Thrills | date=January 5, 2007}} Groban's father was born [[Jew]]ish, and is a descendant of [[Russians|Russian]] and [[Poles|Polish]] immigrants.{{cite web|url=http://www.biggeststars.com/j/josh-groban-biography.html |title=Josh Groban - Biography |publisher=Biggeststars.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-12}} Groban's mother's ancestry includes [[Norwegian American|Norwegian]] (from [[Toten]]), German, and English.{{cite web|url=http://www.grobanarchives.com/transcripts/tra021213a.html |title=Dave 'Til Dawn |publisher=Groban Archives |date=2002-12-13 |accessdate=2011-03-12}}{{cite news| url=http://www.usatoday.com/life/movies/movieawards/sundance/2008-01-20-sundance-concert_N.htm | work=USA Today | title=Josh Groban to sing at Sundance festival | date=January 21, 2008 | accessdate=May 7, 2010 | first=Michael | last=Cidoni}}{{cite web|url=http://www.grobanarchives.com/transcripts/tra061107a.html |title=Josh Groban article |publisher=Grobanarchives.com |date=2006-11-07 |accessdate=2011-03-12}}http://www.huffingtonpost.com/megan-smolenyak-smolenyak/10-things-you-didnt-know-_1_b_1016372.html Groban's father converted from Judaism to Christianity when marrying his mother, and Groban's parents joined the [[Episcopal (United States)|Episcopal]] Church.[http://www.joshgrobanlive.com/bio.php "Bio"]. April 12, 2008. joshgrobanlive.com. AJT Enterprises. He has a younger brother, Chris, who shares the same birthday, four years later. Groban debuted as a singer in the seventh grade. His music teacher chose him to sing a solo of "S'wonderful" at the school's Cabaret Night, where he sang alone on stage for the first time. At this time, he was more focused on theatrical arts. In the summers of 1997 and 1998, he also attended the [[Interlochen Center for the Arts]] Camp in Michigan, majoring in music theatre, and began taking vocal lessons. Groban went on to attend the [[Los Angeles County High School for the Arts]] as a theatre major and graduated in 1999. He was admitted to [[Carnegie Mellon University]], intending to study drama, but he left four months into his first semester. Offered a recording contract, he decided to pursue his singing career. ==Career== ===Early career=== In late 1998, the 17-year-old Groban was introduced by his [[vocal coach]] to [[Grammy Award|Grammy]]-winning producer/arranger [[David Foster]] and future manager Brian Avnet. At the time Groban had no recording experience and was preparing to begin studying at [[Carnegie Institute of Technology]]. Groban worked for David Foster as a rehearsal singer on a series of high-profile events, including the January 1999 inauguration of [[Gray Davis]] as Governor of [[California]] and the [[41st Grammy Awards|1999 Grammy Awards]] where â as a stand-in for [[Andrea Bocelli]] â he rehearsed Foster's "[[The Prayer (CÃ©line Dion and Andrea Bocelli song)|The Prayer]]" with [[Celine Dion|CÃ©line Dion]]. According to manager Avnet, Groban was very nervous about standing in for Bocelli and had to be talked into it, but his performance prompted the show hostess, [[Rosie O'Donnell]], to ask him to appear on [[The Rosie O'Donnell Show|her show]] the following week, which then led to an appearance on the [[Ally McBeal]] show.{{cite web |url=http://www.hitquarters.com/index.php3?page=intrview/opar/intrview_BrianAvnetInterview.html |title=Interview with Brian Avnet |publisher=[[HitQuarters]]|date=16 Feb 2004 |accessdate=21 Dec 2010}} [[David E. Kelley]], creator of the television series ''[[Ally McBeal]],'' created a character, Malcolm Wyatt, for Groban in the season finale aired in May 2001. The character of Malcolm Wyatt was so popular, prompting 8,000 emails from viewers, that Groban was asked to return the next season to reprise his role and perform "[[To Where You Are]]." Avnet claims this sequence of events effectively got Groban's career off the ground. Groban was offered a recording contract at [[Warner Bros. Records]] through Foster's [[143 Records]] imprint. Avnet told [[HitQuarters]] that Warner initially proved resistant to the deal because "They were afraid they wouldnât be able to get a voice like that on radio." Explaining his reasons for signing the artist, Foster said: "I love his natural ability in the pop and rock arena, but I love his sense of classics even more. He's a true musical force to be reckoned with."{{cite web|url=http://www.joshgroban.com/ |title=Official Josh Groban site |publisher=Joshgroban.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-12}} Under Foster's influence, Groban's first album focused more on classics such as "Gira Con Me Questa Notte" and "Alla Luce Del Sole." Groban performed "[[There for Me (Sarah Brightman song)|There For Me]]" with [[Sarah Brightman]] on her 2000â01 ''La Luna World Tour'', and was featured on her "La Luna" concert DVD. He recorded "For Always" with [[Lara Fabian]] on the movie soundtrack to ''[[A.I. (film)|A.I.: Artificial Intelligence]]'' (2001). Groban performed in many benefit shows, including: "The Andre Agassi Grand Slam Event For Children," singing alongside [[Elton John]], [[Stevie Wonder]], [[Don Henley]], and [[Robin Williams]]; "Muhammad Ali's Fight Night Foundation" which honored [[Michael J. Fox]] and others; "The Family Celebration" (2001), which was co-hosted by President [[Bill Clinton]] and his wife, [[Hillary Rodham Clinton]], and [[David E. Kelley]] and his wife, [[Michelle Pfeiffer]]; and Michael Milken's CapCure event, which raises funds for cancer research. The singer's self-titled debut album ''[[Josh Groban (album)|Josh Groban]]'' was released on November 20, 2001. Over the next year, it went from [[Music recording sales certification|gold]] to [[Music recording sales certification|double-platinum]].[http://www.riaa.com/news/newsletter/120602.asp New Sets By Industry Vets Post Strong Sales]{{Dead link|date=August 2010}} ''[[RIAA]] newsletter December 4, 2002'' On February 24, 2002, Groban performed "The Prayer" with [[Charlotte Church]] at the closing ceremonies of the Winter Olympics in Salt Lake City, and by November, he had his own [[Public Broadcasting Service|PBS]] special, "Josh Groban In Concert" (2002). In December 2002, he performed "To Where You Are" and sang "[[The Prayer (Celine Dion and Andrea Bocelli song)|The Prayer]]" in a duet with [[Sissel KyrkjebÃ¸]] at the [[Nobel Peace Prize Concert]] in Oslo, Norway. He joined [[The Corrs]], [[Ronan Keating]], [[Sting (musician)|Sting]], [[Lionel Richie]], and others for a Christmas performance at the [[Vatican City|Vatican]] in Rome, Italy. In 2003, Groban performed at the David Foster concert for World Children's Day, singing "The Prayer" with [[Celine Dion]] and the finale song, "Aren't They All Our Children?" with artists including [[Yolanda Adams]], [[Nick Carter (musician)|Nick Carter]], [[Enrique Iglesias]], and [[Celine Dion]]. ===Recent years=== [[File:Josh Groban Manchester NH 05.JPG|thumb|Groban in concert at the [[Verizon Wireless Arena]] in [[Manchester, NH]]|right]] Groban's second album ''[[Closer (Josh Groban album)|Closer]]'', produced and written by Foster, was released on November 11, 2003. Groban said that he believed that this second album was a better reflection of him, and that his audience would be able to get a better idea of his personality from listening to it. "What most people know about me, they know through my music. This time, I've tried to open that door as wide as possible. These songs are a giant step closer to who I really am and what my music is all about. Hence the title." Two months after ''Closer'' was released, it rose on the ''Billboard'' charts from number 11 to number one. His cover of [[Brian Kennedy (singer)|Brian Kennedy]]'s "[[You Raise Me Up]]" became very popular on the [[Adult contemporary music|adult contemporary]] charts. Groban also performed the song "Remember" (with [[Tanja Tzarovska]]) on the ''[[Troy (film)|Troy]]'' soundtrack, "[[Believe (The Polar Express song)|Believe]]" on the [[The Polar Express (soundtrack)|soundtrack]] to the 2004 animated film ''[[The Polar Express (film)|The Polar Express]]'', and a cover of [[Linkin Park]]'s "My December". In the summer of 2004, Groban returned to Interlochen, performing and discussing his earlier experiences with local residents and campers. On November 30, 2004, his second live [[DVD]], ''Live At The [[Greek Theatre (Los Angeles)|Greek]]'', was released; it was also shown as a ''[[Great Performances]]'' special on [[Public Broadcasting Service|PBS]]. Also in 2004, Groban performed "Remember When It Rained," backed by a full orchestra, at the [[American Music Awards]], where he was nominated for Favorite Male Artist in the pop category. Groban and his recordings were nominated for more than a dozen awards in 2004, including the American Music Award, a [[World Music Award]], an [[Academy Awards|Academy Award]], and a [[Grammy Award|Grammy]]. Groban has appeared on ''[[The Oprah Winfrey Show]]'' six times,[http://www.joshgroban.com/bio "Josh Groban Biography"]. Josh Groban. as well as on ''[[The Ellen Degeneres Show]]'', ''[[Larry King Live]]'', ''[[The Rosie O'Donnell Show]]'', ''[[Tim & Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!]]'', ''[[The Jay Leno Show]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.tv.com/the-tonight-show-with-jay-leno/simon-cowell-rob-schneider-josh-groban/episode/1203109/summary.html |title=The Tonight Show with Jay Leno: Simon Cowell; Rob Schneider; Josh Groban Episode Summary on |publisher=Tv.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-12}} ''[[20/20 (US television series)|20/20]]'', ''[[Today (NBC program)|Today]]'', [[Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade]], [[Super Bowl XXXVIII]], the Walt Disney World Christmas Day Parade, the Rockefeller Tree Lighting, and ''[[Glee (TV series)|Glee]]''. During the first week of September 2006, Groban's single entitled "[[You Are Loved (Don't Give Up)]]" was released exclusively on [[AOL]]'s First Listen. His third studio album ''[[Awake (Josh Groban album)|Awake]]'' was officially released on November 7, 2006. Groban performed "You Are Loved (Don't Give Up)" as well as two other tracks from ''Awake'' at his recording session for ''[[Live from Abbey Road]]'' at [[Abbey Road Studios]] on 26 October 2006. On that album, Groban also collaborated with British musician and songwriter [[Imogen Heap]], on the single "Now or Never". He performed two tracks with the South African group [[Ladysmith Black Mambazo]], "Lullaby" and "Weeping." Groban's "Awake" world tour visited 71 cities between February and August 2007, and travelled further to Australia and the Philippines with [[Lani Misalucha]] as his special guest in October 2007. He performed a duet with [[Barbra Streisand]] ("All I Know of Love") and with [[Mireille Mathieu]] ("Over the Rainbow"). As to his future, Groban is open to a plethora of possibilities. He said, "I am fortunate enough to have had many really big moments in my career. I think the mistake a lot of people in my position make is to always search for the next big thing. I am looking forward to playing some small theaters. I'm looking forward to writing more. I want to delve further into my acting career and explore some of the film and TV opportunities that I haven't had time for. My outlook is to expect the unexpected. And when the next step comes, I'm prepared to take it." Groban has also expressed an interest in performing on [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]].{{cite web|url=http://www.notablebiographies.com/news/Ge-La/Groban-Josh.html |title=Josh Groban Biography - life, children, parents, school, mother, young, old, information, born, college |publisher=Notablebiographies.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-12}} Groban has twice appeared on hit British TV Music Quiz show [[Never Mind the Buzzcocks|Never Mind The Buzzcocks]]. His first appearance was as a guest on [[Omid Djalili|Omid Djalili's]] team and the second appearance was as the host/quiz master of an episode. ===2010âpresent=== Groban finished his fifth studio album, entitled ''[[Illuminations (Josh Groban album)|Illuminations]]'', and the album was released on November 15, 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.joshgroban.com/news/2010/08/31/new-album-illuminations-coming-soon |title=New Album Illuminations - Coming Soon! | Official Josh Groban |publisher=Joshgroban.com |date=2010-09-01 |accessdate=2011-03-12}} Most of the songs on the album are about "specific situations that I've had where love has existed and ultimately failed," Groban told [[The New York Times]], adding: "And other songs are about the quest, and it just not working out." Groban wrote 11 of the 13 songs on the album.{{cite web|url=http://www.accesshollywood.com/josh-groban-dishes-on-his-new-album-and-love-life-i-am-a-single-man_article_39697 |title=Josh Groban Dishes On His New Album & Love Life | Access Hollywood - Celebrity News, Photos & Videos |publisher=Access Hollywood |date=2010-11-12 |accessdate=2011-03-12}} The first single from the album, "[[Hidden Away]]," was made available for free download via Facebook on September 8.[http://www.amazon.com/dp/B0041ZQ7P2 "Hidden Away"], [[Amazon.com]] âFor me to sit in a room with a piano in one take with some of [[Johnny Cash]]âs musicians â that was totally new for me.â Josh added. âand I think that excitement is on the record.â On October 12, a second single from the upcoming album, "VocÃª Existe Em Mim", was made available on iTunes.{{cite web|url=http://www.joshgroban.com/news/new-song-voce-existe-em-mim-available-itunes-now |title=New Song "Voce Existe Em Mim" Available on iTunes Now | Official Josh Groban |publisher=Joshgroban.com |date=2010-10-11 |accessdate=2011-03-12}} This song is sung in Brazilian Portuguese and was written by Brazilian artist [[Carlinhos Brown]]. The [[Washington Post]] said: "Illuminations" is not a revelation, but it offers a perfectly fine, and often quite lovely, glimpse at a pop-classical crossover artist in the middle of crossing over."{{cite news| url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/11/15/AR2010111506565.html?hpid=sec-artsliving | work=The Washington Post | first=Allison | last=Stewart | title='Illuminations': Josh Groban is still a swell guy | date=November 16, 2010}} Josh plans on making one more record with [[Rick Rubin]].{{cite web|url=http://www.undercover.fm/news/13189-josh-groban-plans-more-records-with-rick-rubin |title=Undercover News: Josh Groban Plans More Records With Rick Rubin |publisher=Undercover.fm |date=2010-12-29 |accessdate=2011-03-12}} Beginning May 12, 2011, Groban is scheduled to embark on a worldwide tour entitled [[Straight to You Tour]] to promote ''Illuminations''.{{cite press release |title=Josh Groban Announces 2011 "Straight To You" World Tour |url=http://www.marketwire.com/press-release/Josh-Groban-Announces-2011-Straight-To-You-World-Tour-1395413.htm |publisher=[[Marketwire]] |date=14 February 2011 |accessdate=9 March 2011}} On Tuesday, May 24, 2011, he appeared as a mystery guest star on the season 12 finale of [[Dancing With the Stars]] to surprise Petra Nemcova by singing "You Raise Me Up" to her dance. When she saw that it was he who was actually singing the song and not one of the usual performers, she momentarily was too stunned to continue dancing. ===Film=== In the comedy ''[[Crazy, Stupid, Love.]]'', a film starring [[Emma Stone]] and [[Steve Carell]], released on July 29, 2011, Groban played a character named Richard, a caddish and nerdy attorney.{{cite web|url=http://www.tribute.ca/movies/Crazy,+Stupid,+Love/cast/24044 |title=Crazy, Stupid, Love Cast and Actor Biographies | Movie Cast and Credits |publisher=Tribute.ca |date= |accessdate=2011-03-12}}{{cite news| url=http://www.nytimes.com/2010/11/14/arts/music/14groban.html?_r=1 | work=The New York Times | first=Nate | last=Chinen | title=Josh Groban's Album âIlluminations' | date=November 11, 2010}} ===Television=== Groban appeared in ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]'' as [[Andy Bernard]]'s brother in the episode "[[Garden Party (The Office)|Garden Party]]".{{cite web|url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2011/08/18/josh-groban-the-office/ |title=Josh Groban appearing on 'The Office' as Andy's brother |publisher=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |date=18 August 2011}} Groban had a guest-appearance in the music series Glee in 2010, as himself, a judge for regionals.http://www.joshgroban.com/news/2010/04/16/josh-glee-season-finale ==Notable performances== [[File:Josh Groban.jpg|thumb|Groban at the ET Post-Emmys Party, Walt Disney Concert Hall, September 21, 2008|right]] On April 14, 2007, Groban joined [[Idina Menzel]] for a [[Public Broadcasting Service|PBS]] ''[[Soundstage (TV program)|Soundstage]]'' taping. In a 2002 ''[[New York Times]]'' article, Groban described himself as a "tenor in training".Gurewitsch, Matthew [http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9C04E7D71538F93BA15754C0A9649C8B63&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=al "MUSIC; The New Boy Wonder of the Voice"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', July 9, 2008. ==Charity== [[Image:Josh Groban in a concert.jpg|250px|thumb|Josh Groban in concert at Atlantic City's Boardwalk Hall|right]] Under the guidance of his mentor [[David Foster]], Groban performed for many charity events that included VH1 Save the Music (2005), Tsunami Aid: A Concert of Hope (2005), Fifth Adopt-A-Annual Minefield concert (2005), 2nd Annual Grammy Jam (2005), [[Live 8]] (2005), The Heart Foundation Gala (2005), and David Foster and Friends Charity Gala (2006). He also sang a solo on the recording of [[We Are The World 25 for Haiti]] (2010). Inspired by a visit with [[Nelson Mandela]] during a 2004 trip to South Africa, he established the Josh Groban Foundation to help children in need through education, healthcare and the arts. Mandela appointed Groban as an Official Ambassador for Mandela's Project [[46664 (concerts)|46664]], a campaign to help raise Global awareness of HIV/AIDS in Africa. On April 25, 2007, Josh Groban performed with the [[African Children's Choir]] on ''[[American Idol]]'''s "Idol Gives Back" episode. Also on September 2, 2007, Groban donated $150,000 to [[Charlotte-Mecklenburg Schools]] to fund music education.[http://www.cms.k12.nc.us/includes/gfi.asp?fileHandle=4547.asptopicID=2.topic Singer Josh Groban donates $150,000 to CMS] On February 28, 2008, he appeared in [http://www.onenightlive.ca/ One Night Live] at the [[Air Canada Centre]] in Toronto, Canada with [[Bryan Adams]], [[Sarah McLachlan]], [[Jann Arden]] and [[RyanDan]] in aid of the [[Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre|Sunnybrook Hospital]] Women and Babies Program. In honor of his 27th birthday, his fans set out to raise $27,000 in a project called "Raise 27". They ended up raising a total of $44,227 for the Josh Groban Foundation, to benefit the Noah's Ark children's orphanage called Siyawela in South Africa. Groban has since referred to this donation as "the best birthday present ever".{{cite web|author=Started By |url=http://joshgroban.yuku.com/topic/7596/t/THANK-YOU.html?page=1 |title=Josh Groban Says Thank You to Fans |publisher=Joshgroban.yuku.com |date=2004-09-02 |accessdate=2011-03-12}} For those who could afford the $1500 ticket, Josh Groban performed at the The Angel Ball on October 21, 2010.
